page.title: 01The Area around Cattistock
page.content: This is an agricultural area of small and medium sized farms, with dairy farming predominating, set in the hilly chalk downland of West Dorset and designated as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The River Frome runs from north to south through the area, one and a half miles from its source, with the single track of the Westbury to Weymouth railway branch line running alongside. The main A.356 road runs for half a mile through the south west corner of the area, otherwise the villages, hamlets and farms are connected by narrow country lanes. There are also about six miles of footpaths. Tourism has little impact. A few holiday cottages being let to holiday visitors and a few private houses providing bed and breakfast accommodation.
